org.codeandmagic.timeline
Class LinearAxisLocator

java.lang.Object
  org.codeandmagic.timeline.LinearAxisLocator
All Implemented Interfaces:
AxisLocator
public class LinearAxisLocator
extends java.lang.Object
implements AxisLocator

AxisLocator that positions the axes temporary linear, similar with how LinearHorizontalLocator positions Events. You can specify the number of axes through setTimeStep(int).

WARNING: This class should be used only together with a LinearHorizontalLocator or a EventHorizontalLocator that uses a linear time formula and doesn't have gaps.
YOU NEED TO SYNCHRONIZE THE SCALE SET IN THIS CLASS AND THE ONE SET ON THE LinearHorizontalLocator.

Author:
cristi

computeX in interface AxisLocator

setTimeStep

public void setTimeStep(int timeStep)
Sets the distance between the axes in hours. One axis will be position at the 0 hour of one day then at all the hours of the day that have the time step as divisor: hour(time) mod timeStep == 0.

Parameters:
timeStep -

public void setScale(float scale)
Sets the time scale. The time scale represents the number of milliseconds that are compressed into one pixel. WARNING: This class should be used only together with a LinearHorizontalLocator or a

YOU NEED TO SYNCHRONIZE THIS WITH THE SCALE SET ON THE LinearHorizontalLocator.
